technicalSpec.title: How to create a Technical Specification
technicalSpec.subtitle: A detailed guide on writing effective technical specifications for your project

section1.title: What is a Technical Specification?
section1.content1: A technical specification (TS) is a detailed document that describes the technical requirements, architecture, and implementation details of your project. It serves as a blueprint for developers and helps ensure everyone understands what needs to be built.
section1.content2: A well-written TS saves time, reduces misunderstandings, and helps estimate project costs and timelines more accurately.

section2.title: What to include in your TS

item1.title: Project Overview
item1.content: Brief description of what you want to build, target audience, and main goals.

item2.title: Functional Requirements
item2.content: Detailed list of features and functionality your system should have. Be specific about user interactions, data processing, and system behavior.

item3.title: Technical Requirements
item3.content: Specify technologies, platforms, integrations, performance requirements, and any technical constraints.

example1.title: Good Example
example1.content: Create a user registration form with email validation, password requirements (8+ chars, special symbols), and email confirmation. Store user data in PostgreSQL database.

example2.title: Bad Example
example2.content: Make a form for users to sign up. It should work well and be secure.

section4.title: Tips for writing effective TS
section4.content: Be specific and detailed. Use clear language. Include examples and use cases. Consider edge cases and error handling. Break down complex features into smaller components.
section4.tip: The more detailed your specification, the more accurate our estimate will be and the faster we can start development.

terms.title: Terms and Conditions
terms.subtitle: Please read our terms and conditions before proceeding with your order

section1.title: Agreement Overview
section1.content1: By submitting your order, you agree to these terms and conditions. This agreement governs the relationship between you (the client) and AutoFina (the service provider).
section1.content2: These terms apply to all services provided by AutoFina, including but not limited to automation solutions, web development, and consulting services.

item1.title: Project Scope
item1.content: The scope of work is defined in the technical specification provided by the client. Any changes to the scope may result in additional costs and timeline adjustments.

item2.title: Timeline and Delivery
item2.content: Project timelines are estimates based on the provided requirements. Delays may occur due to scope changes, technical complexity, or client feedback cycles.

item3.title: Payment Terms
item3.content: Payment is due according to the agreed schedule. We accept bank transfers and cryptocurrency payments. Late payments may incur additional fees.

item1.title: Client Rights
item1.content: Upon full payment, the client receives full ownership of the delivered code and documentation, excluding third-party libraries and frameworks.

item2.title: Confidentiality
item2.content: We maintain strict confidentiality regarding your project details and business information. All communications and project data are protected under NDA.

section4.title: Support and Warranty
section4.content: We provide 30 days of free support for bug fixes and minor adjustments after project delivery. Major feature changes are not included in the warranty period.
section4.contact: For questions about these terms, contact us via Telegram or email.
